reviews.title: Lovely place for a quiet getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night in the Cissbury room and can report that feedback from the previous reviewer seems to have been acted upon - the hostess appeared to be keeping an eye out for us and greeted us in the carpark at 5.30, also after a long drive. We were shown up to the room which we found spacious by comparison with other B&Bs on this trip, and for the first time we had a spacious bathroom, with a bath rather than just a shower. The room was well appointed and we had no trouble with the Sky card, but found it surprising that with so many Sky channels on offer, this a pub without any sports channels! (We had hoped to watch a replay of the All Blacks game from that morning). The bed was supremely comfortable and both of us had the best sleep - great! Breakfast was average, and would have benefitted from the use of fresh summer fruit eg perhaps a fruit salad rather than the sole fruit option of a half-grapefruit - but the home made bread toast was very good.
reviews.title: Best sleep this tour - recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the Firle room which is a good size. The room and ensuite were spotless. Nicely decorated and four poster bed. We ate in the evening and it was great good quality resturant food. Staff and owners were very helpful, log fire what more would you want.
reviews.title: The place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: myself and two freinds stayed here for two nights and found it delightfull. the bedrooms are large ensuite rooms, very comfortable and well furnished. the beds are very good and we all commented what a good nights sleep we had. the food was of high standard and the owners were very welcoming and ready to help you in any way. we would not hesitate to stay here again if visiting this delightfull part of sussex. thankyou both for a wonderfull stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic nights sleep - but not so welcoming

reviews.text: By far the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in, which is the reason I've given the place 5 stars. Sleep quality was wonderful, and we didn't notice any road noise with the windows closed. We stayed in the Stoke room.
reviews.title: great accommodation and very friendly proprietors

reviews.text: Upon arrival we received no smiles or welcoming greetings.. we arrived and explained we had a reservation, an older lady said "I'll show them their room" to her colleague, and we followed with our bags. Upon entering the room it was explained to us what the key did (..allow access to the room!) and we were left. We would have appreciated being told of restaurant/breakfast times or local amenities. We were left wondering if they particularly disliked 20-something couples or northerners.
reviews.title: What a country inn should be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed here for two nights as a base for visiting Brighton (only 15 mins away).We had the Cuckmere room which was really nice-clean ,modern and comfortable with a lovely big well equipped bathroom.Only slight problem is traffic noise which starts fairly early in the morning.The restaurant is Olde Worlde but very atmospheric.The menu is comprehensive with a definite leaning to fish and seafood .Food was excellent and very reasonably priced,The owners and staff are very friendly,helpful and efficient.Altogether,highly recommended.
reviews.title: A Great stay

reviews.text: Stayed here twice for a few days at a time whilst dealing with a family bereavement - on both occasions the staff and owners were friendly, helpful, professional and considerate.
reviews.title: Definately recommended

reviews.text: The bedrooms and bathrooms are large, nicely decorated and well appointed.
